title: Texas Abortion Ruling Overcame a Ban Designed to Thwart Courts
sub_head: The state asked a conservative-leaning appellate court to lift the injunction that blocked its near-total abortion ban
body:
It was no ordinary ruling that put a stop to Texas’s unprecedented abortion law.
For a five-week stretch, abortion was almost abolished in the country’s second-most populous state—the result of a law called the Texas Heartbeat Act, or SB 8, a ban on the procedure after six weeks of pregnancy that had defied constitutional protections under Roe v. Wade and eluded judicial review.
